skill.name: css-development
skill.description: This skill should be used when working with CSS, creating components, styling elements, refactoring styles, or reviewing CSS code. Triggers on "CSS", "styles", "Tailwind", "dark mode", "component styling", "semantic class", "@apply", "stylesheet". Routes to specialized sub-skills for creation, validation, or refactoring.

skill.author: 2389-research

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill system with no code execution, no network operations, and no external data access. All file operations are limited to reading project CSS files and creating/modifying styles within the user's project directory.

content.user_title: Create and validate semantic CSS components
content.value_statement: Creating and maintaining consistent CSS across a codebase is difficult. Developers struggle with naming conventions, dark mode support, and testing. This skill provides guided workflows for creating, validating, and refactoring CSS components with semantic naming, Tailwind composition, and dark mode by default.
actual_capabilities: Creates new CSS components with semantic naming conventions
Validates existing CSS against established patterns
Refactors inline styles to semantic class patterns
Adds dark mode support to all components automatically
Generates test coverage for CSS classes
limitations: Only works with CSS files and markup
Requires a styles/components.css file for best results
Does not generate completely new design systems

use_cases.title: Create new component classes
use_cases.description: Build new CSS components following semantic naming and Tailwind composition patterns.

use_cases.title: Refactor legacy styles
use_cases.description: Convert inline styles and utility classes to maintainable semantic component patterns.

use_cases.title: Audit CSS consistency
use_cases.description: Validate CSS files for naming conventions, dark mode coverage, and test coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Create component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new button-primary component class in styles/components.css following the semantic naming pattern.

prompt_templates.title: Validate CSS
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the CSS in styles/components.css against semantic naming and dark mode patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor styles
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor the inline styles in components/ to use semantic classes with dark mode support.

prompt_templates.title: Full workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new card component with header, body, and footer variants including dark mode and tests.

output_examples.input: Validate my CSS styles and suggest improvements
output: Semantic naming: 8 classes reviewed, 2 need renaming (.btn-blue -> .button-primary)
Dark mode coverage: 75% complete, 3 classes missing variants
Test coverage: 60% complete, 4 classes need static CSS tests
Recommended actions: Add dark: variants to .card-header, .badge, .empty-state

best_practices: Use semantic class names that describe purpose, not appearance
Include dark mode variants for all colored and interactive elements
Compose Tailwind utilities via @apply for centralized styling
anti_patterns: Leaving inline styles scattered across markup
Creating components without dark mode support

faq.question: Does this work with SCSS or Sass files?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on plain CSS. For preprocessors, the patterns still apply but you would need to adapt the file locations.

faq.question: How many CSS classes can it handle at once?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit. The skill processes files based on the scope of your request.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing test suite?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill generates tests for vitest and React Testing Library patterns. Adapt the templates for other frameworks.

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: It only reads files within your project directory that you explicitly reference. No data is sent anywhere.

faq.question: Why are my styles not being detected?
faq.answer: Ensure styles/components.css exists at the expected path. Check that you are using the skill keywords like CSS or styling.

faq.question: How is this different from using Tailwind directly?
faq.answer: This skill enforces consistent patterns, semantic naming, dark mode coverage, and test coverage that raw Tailwind does not provide.
